intro: Draco timorensis, commonly known as the Timor dragon tree, is a rare and unique plant native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It is a member of the Dracaena genus and is characterized by its distinctive, twisted, and often gnarled appearance. The plant produces red sap, which has been historically used for various purposes, including traditional medicine. Draco timorensis thrives in tropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species.
